description: A large rigid steel boom.  If attached to a frame it could be used to lift up to 20 metric tonnes (or a bit over 44,000 pounds).
A small steel telescoping cantilever.  If attached to a frame it could be used to lift up to 3.5 metric tonnes (or a bit over 7,700 pounds).
A makeshift pallet lifter.  If attached to a frame it could be used to lift up to 0.5 metric tonnes (or a bit over 1,100 pounds).
A large and heavy jagged metal disc to dig trenches.
An extendable metal pylon used to replace a portable jack.  If mounted to a vehicle, it could be used to lift it up, supporting vehicles up to 8.5 metric tonnes (or a bit over 1,100 pounds).
A kickstand to keep the bike from falling over.  You could use this to lean it forward or backward to change a tire, supporting vehicles up to 0.5 metric tonnes (or a bit over 18,700 pounds).
A makeshift crane made from rope and pulleys.  If attached to a frame it could be used to lift up to 2 metric tonnes (or a bit over 4,400 pounds).
